Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
En route to the safe zone, your pilot notices a strange reading and discovers an Imperial tracking beacon amongst the cargo. Luckily, you've only begun the journey and it would be difficult for the Empire to determine your destination. Tracing the signal, you leave to destroy what you assume is Terro’s Tatooine listening post.

"Looks difficult", the captain of the team of Alliance rangers says when you show her the readings. "We'll protect the convoy while you're away, but you should still be careful."

Some time later, you arrive at Terro's listening post in the Tatooine desert.

eventActions.theText:
Your pilot drops you off at a hidden rear entrance of the base.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
As soon as you open the doors, Imperial security protocols activate. Heavy locks slide over the doors, and soldiers scramble to their defensive positions.
The door appears to be controlled by a single computer console.

entityProperties.name: Terminal 1
entityProperties.theText:
The security console is humming softly.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal to discard it. When the terminal is discarded, the door unlocks.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The door is locked.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal to discard it. When the terminal is discarded, the door unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.
Disable the security systems.

{-} The door is locked.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal to discard it. When the terminal is discarded, the door unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
“Who gave you these coordinates?" Captain Terro demands as he lies defeated, against his dewback. You throw the tracking beacon at his feet. The Captain musters a weak chuckle. “We've both been had, This is one of Jabba's devices. Seems he's grown tired of us monitoring him. And with you here... well, who’s defending your fleet, Rebels?"

Terro’s brittle laughter has scarcely faded when you receive a message from High Command. After pitting his enemies against each other, Jabba moved in to capture the defenseless Rebel fleet. You finish disabling the Imperial station before steeling yourself for a head-on assault on Jabba’s Palace.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} If there is only 1 healthy hero, increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
{-} Place Story Mission card "Storming the Palace" into play.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
“Jabba, we have them,” Captain Terro reports to the Hutt lord. After ending the transmission he turns to you. “When Jabba told me you would be coming, I didn't believe him. The Empire wants you dead, and so does the Hutt. I will be paid twice for the same job.”

Fully restrained, you are transported back to Jabba's palace, where Captain Terro receives a heavy pouch from Bib Fortuna before escorting you to the skiffs.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission card "Mutiny" into play.
{-} If <color="red">Captain Terro</color> has suffered {H}, heroes receive 25 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Terminal Discarded 1
globalEvents.eventText: You disable the security systems, unlocking the door.

entityProperties.name: Terminal 1
entityProperties.theText:
The security console is humming softly.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal to discard it. When the terminal is discarded, the door unlocks.

entityProperties.name: Door 1
entityProperties.theText: A security door leads deeper into the listening post.

eventActions.theText: Block access to the door.
Move deeper into the base.

{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Captain's Orders
globalEvents.eventText: The door slides open, revealing a control room full of blinking computer consoles.

entityProperties.name: Door 1
entityProperties.theText:
A security door leads deeper into the listening post.

{-} The door is locked. When the terminal is discarded, the door unlocks.

eventActions.theText: Block access to the terminal.
Two red-armored soldiers with force pikes stand guard at a door leading out of the base.

Standing at one of the computer consoles, Captain Terro looks up. "Rebels? Here?" He shakes his head. "You had escaped; why put your head back in the rancor's mouth? He turns to his guards. "Get them!"

{-} Deploy a single Stormtrooper figure as indicated. This is Terro.

eventActions.bonuses:
INSPIRE THE TROOPS: At the start of this activation, each Imperial figure within 3 spaces of this figure discards 1 Harmful condition. Each of those figures that did not discard a condition recovers 1 {H}.
SUPPORT THE CAPTAIN: At the start of this activation, this figure recovers 1 {H} for each Imperial figure within 3 spaces of it.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{-} SQUAD COMMAND: The closest other Imperial figure that isn’t Focused becomes Focused.
{A} FIRE AT WILL: The closest other Imperial figure that can perform an attack attacks {rebel}.
{Q} Move 4 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 5.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 5.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The door is locked.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal to discard it. When the terminal is discarded and Terro is defeated, the door unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.

entityProperties.name: Terminal 2
entityProperties.theText:
The security console is humming softly.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal to discard it. When the terminal is discarded, the door unlocks.

eventActions.theText: Block access to the door.

globalEvents.name: Retreat
globalEvents.eventText: Terro falls back on his heels and scrambles for the exit. The blast door slams behind him.

globalEvents.name: Second Door Unlocks
globalEvents.eventText: With the post's defenses deactivated, you  can finally destroy the main beacons and complete your mission.

entityProperties.name: Door 2
entityProperties.theText: The door to desert is weathered by sand and wind.

globalEvents.name: Sandstorm
globalEvents.eventText: As you open the door, you realize that a sandstorm is brewing in the distance. Sharp winds are whipping sand particles across the dunes, blurring your vision.

entityProperties.name: Door 2
entityProperties.theText:
The door to desert is weathered by sand and wind.

{-} The door is locked. When the terminal is discarded and Terro is defeated, the door unlocks.

eventActions.theText: Block access to the beacons.
In the distance, you can see the listening post's main beacons, half buried in the sand.

entityProperties.name: Beacon 1
entityProperties.theText:
Half hidden in the sand, the Imperial tracking beacon transmits all the data from the listening post. As long as it is active, your convoy will not be safe.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack a beacon (Health: 8, Defense: 3 {G}). Figures do not block line of sight to beacons.

entityProperties.name: Beacon 2
entityProperties.theText:
Half hidden in the sand, the Imperial tracking beacon transmits all the data from the listening post. As long as it is active, your convoy will not be safe.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack a beacon (Health: 8, Defense: 3 {G}). Figures do not block line of sight to beacons.

eventActions.theText: {-} Imperial mission tokens represent beacons. A Rebel figure can attack a beacon (Health: 8, Defense: 3 {G}). Figures do not block line of sight to beacons.
Captain Terro has anticipated your plan and rallied a final defense. “No retreat!” Captain Terro barks to his forces. “Prepare to charge!”

You ready your weapons to meet Terro's onslaught when your comlink crackles. "Hey guys", you hear the voice of the captain of your Ranger team. "It looked like you needed help. We got your back." 

The rangers break cover to provide support from atop a large dune. It seems Terro isn't the only one with reinforcements.

With the unexpected backup, you feel more confident as you prepare to face Terro.

{-} The Rebels win when both beacons are destroyed and <color="red">Captain Terro</color> is defeated.
Destroy the beacons (&Beacons Destroyed&/2) and defeat <color="red">Captain Terro</color>.

{-} Imperial mission tokens represent beacons. A Rebel figure can attack a beacon (Health: 8, Defense: 3 {G}). Figures do not block line of sight to beacons.
{-} The Rebels win when both beacons are destroyed and <color="red">Captain Terro</color> is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.
Defeat Terro. Discard the second terminal.

{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.
Discard the second terminal.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal to discard it. When the terminal is discarded, the door unlocks.

{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.
Defeat Terro.

{-} The door is locked.
{-} When Terro is defeated, the door unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.
Find the main beacons outside the base.

{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Captain Terro Defeated
globalEvents.eventText: Terro keeps firing shots and spouts of fire in your direction when a stray blaster bolt spooks his dewback. It rears, almost throwing the stormtrooper captain off. The little distraction is all you need, and your attacks hit him hard. Terro loses balance and collapses to the sands of Tatooine.

eventActions.theText: Destroy the beacons (&Beacons Destroyed&/2).

{-} The Rebels win when both beacons are destroyed.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 7, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Beacon Destroyed 1
globalEvents.eventText: The beacon explodes in a shower of sparks.
